verses.verse: (Isa 22.4; Jer 6.26; 8.21, 22; Lam 2.11) (8.23 in Heb) O that my head were a spring of water and my eyes a fountain of tears, so that I might weep day and night for the slain of the daughter of my people!

(Ps 55.6, 7; Jer 5.7, 8, 11; 12.1, 6) (9.1 in Heb) O that I had in the desert a traveler’s lodging place, that I might leave my people and go away from them! For they are all adulterers, a band of traitors.

(1 Sam 2.12; Ps 64.3; Isa 59.4; Jer 4.22; Hos 4.1) They bend their tongues like bows; they have grown strong in the land for falsehood and not for truth, for they proceed from evil to evil, and they do not know me, says the LORD.
(v 8|JER 9:8; Gen 27.35; Jer 6.28; 12.6) Beware of your neighbors, and put no trust in any of your kin, for all your kin are supplanters, and every neighbor goes around like a slanderer.

(Jer 12.13; 51.58, 64; Mic 6.12) They all deceive their neighbors, and no one speaks the truth; they have taught their tongues to speak lies; they commit iniquity and are too weary to repent. (Cn Compare Gk: Heb they weary themselves with iniquity. 6Your dwelling)
(Jer 5.27; 11.10; Jn 3.19, 20) Oppression upon oppression, deceit (Cn Compare Gk: Heb Your dwelling in the midst of deceit) upon deceit! They refuse to know me, says the LORD.
(Isa 1.25; Hos 11.8; Mal 3.3) Therefore thus says the LORD of hosts: I will now refine and test them, for what else can I do with the daughter of my people?
(Ps 12.2; 28.3; Jer 5.26) Their tongue is a deadly arrow; it speaks deceit through the mouth. They all speak friendly words to their neighbors but inwardly are planning to lay an ambush.
(Jer 5.9, 29) Shall I not punish them for these things? says the LORD, and shall I not bring retribution on a nation such as this?

(Jer 4.24-26; Ezek 14.15; Hos 4.3) Take up (Gk Syr: Heb I will take up) weeping and wailing for the mountains and a lamentation for the pastures of the wilderness, because they are laid waste so that no one passes through, and the lowing of cattle is not heard; both the birds of the air and the animals have fled and are gone.
(Isa 13.22; 25.2; 34.13; Jer 4.27; 26.9) I will make Jerusalem a heap of ruins, a lair of jackals, and I will make the towns of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.

(Ps 107.43; Jer 23.10, 16; Hos 14.9) Who is wise enough to understand this? To whom has the mouth of the LORD spoken, so that they may declare it? Why is the land ruined and laid waste like a wilderness, so that no one passes through?
(Ps 89.30; Jer 5.19) And the LORD says: Because they have forsaken my law that I set before them and have not obeyed my voice or walked in accordance with it
(Rom 1.21-24; Gal 1.14; 1 Pet 1.18) but have stubbornly followed their own hearts and have gone after the Baals, as their ancestors taught them.
(Jer 8.14; 23.15) Therefore thus says the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel: I am feeding this people with wormwood and giving them poisonous water to drink.
(Lev 26.33; Deut 28.64; Jer 44.27; Ezek 5.2) I will scatter them among nations that neither they nor their ancestors have known, and I will send the sword after them until I have consumed them.
The People Mourn in Judgment (2 Chr 35.25; Eccl 12.5; Am 5.16) Thus says the LORD of hosts: Consider and call for the mourning women to come; send for the skilled women to come;
(Jer 14.17) let them quickly raise a dirge over us, so that our eyes may run down with tears and our eyelids flow with water.
(Jer 4.13; 7.15) For a sound of wailing is heard from Zion: “How we are ruined! We are utterly shamed because we have left the land, because they have cast down our dwellings.”
(Isa 32.9) Hear, O women, the word of the LORD, and let your ears receive the word of his mouth; teach to your daughters a dirge and each to her neighbor a lament.
(Jer 6.11; 15.7; 18.21) “Death has come up into our windows; it has entered our palaces to cut off the children from the streets and the young men from the squares.”
(Jer 8.2; 16.4) Speak! Thus says the LORD: “Human corpses shall fall like dung upon the open field, like sheaves behind the reaper, and no one shall gather them.”
(Ps 49.6-9; Eccl 9.11; Isa 10.8-12) Thus says the LORD: Do not let the wise boast in their wisdom; do not let the mighty boast in their might; do not let the wealthy boast in their wealth;

(Ps 36.5, 7; Mic 7.18; 1 Cor 1.31; 2 Cor 10.17; Gal 6.14) but let those who boast boast in this, that they understand and know me, that I am the LORD; I act with steadfast love, justice, and righteousness in the earth, for in these things I delight, says the LORD.
(Rom 2.8, 9) The days are surely coming, says the LORD, when I will attend to all those who are circumcised only in the foreskin:

(Lev 26.41; Jer 25.23; Ezek 44.7; Rom 2.28) Egypt, Judah, Edom, the Ammonites, Moab, and all those with shaved temples who live in the desert. For all these nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel is uncircumcised in heart.
